meanings.definition: A person or thing that catches
meanings.sent1: The catchers in the zoo feed the animals every day.
meanings.sent2: The catchers in the game caught all the balls thrown to them.
meanings.sent3: The catchers at the party were quick to grab the falling balloons.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like catchers, capturing every detail of the scene.
meanings.sent5: The catchers in the net collected all the falling leaves.

meanings.definition: A player positioned behind home plate in baseball
meanings.sent1: The catchers in the baseball game wear protective gear.
meanings.sent2: The catchers in the team have to be quick to catch the pitches.
meanings.sent3: The catchers behind home plate celebrated every successful catch with a dance.
meanings.sent4: The catchers on the field were like guardians protecting the home plate.
meanings.sent5: The catchers in baseball have to have good reflexes to catch the fast balls.

meanings.definition: A device used to catch something, such as a fish or a criminal
meanings.sent1: The fisherman's catchers helped him reel in a big fish.
meanings.sent2: The police officer used the catchers to apprehend the criminal.
meanings.sent3: The clever catchers in the trap caught the sneaky mouse.
meanings.sent4: The catchers in the security system caught the intruder red-handed.
meanings.sent5: The catchers in the fishing net trapped a variety of sea creatures.
